metadata.NameShort: Unit or Basis for Measurement Code

data.1A: Car Mile - One freight car moving one mile
data.1B: Car Count - The number of freight cars moving over a specified track
data.1C: Locomotive Count - The number of locomotives moved over a specified track
data.1D: Caboose Count - The number of cabooses moved over a specified track
data.1E: Empty Car - Unloaded or empty cars moving over a specified track
data.1F: Train Mile - The first locomotive in a train moving one mile
data.1G: Fuel Usage (Gallons) - The number of gallons of diesel fuel used to move a train or all trains over specified trackage
data.1H: Caboose Mile - One caboose moving one mile
data.1I: Fixed Rate - Indicates a predetermined or set rate for usage of a facility
data.1J: Ton Miles - Tons of freight multiplied by the number of times moved; includes non-revenue freight such as material used to maintain trackage and right-of-way
data.1K: Locomotive Mile - One locomotive moving one mile
data.1L: Total Car Count - The sum of cars, locomotives, and cabooses moving over a specified track; the conversion rate for locomotives and cabooses is set by contract
data.1M: Total Car Mile - The sum of car miles, locomotive miles, and caboose miles moved over a specified track; the conversion rate for locomotives and cabooses is set by contract
data.2A: Radians Per Second - Measure of angular velocity
data.2B: Radians Per Second Squared - Measure of angular acceleration
data.2C: Roentgen - Unit of X-radiation or gamma radiation equal to the amount of radiation that produces in one cubic centimeter of dry air at 0 degrees Celsius and standard atmospheric pressure ionization of either sign equal to one electrostatic unit of charge
data.2F: Volts Per Meter - Measure of electrical field strength
data.2G: Volts (Alternating Current) - Measure of electrical potential
data.2H: Volts (Direct Current) - Measure of electrical potential
data.2I: British Thermal Units (BTUs) Per Hour - British thermal units per hour
data.2J: Cubic Centimeters Per Second - Rate of flow
data.2K: Cubic Feet Per Hour - Rate of flow
data.2L: Cubic Feet Per Minute - Rate of flow
data.2M: Centimeters Per Second - Rate of speed
data.2N: Decibels - A unit for expressing the relative intensity of sounds on a scale of 0 for the least perceptible sound to about 130 for the average pain level
data.2P: Kilobyte - Unit of computer storage capacity equal to 1000 bytes
data.2W: Bin - Storage container used as a unit of measurement
data.2X: Meters Per Minute - Measure of linear speed
data.3B: Megajoule - Unit of energy or heat
data.3C: Manmonth - Measure of work output by a single person during a typical work month
data.4A: Bobbin - A cylinder or spindle on which yarn or thread is wound
data.4B: Cap - Designates that the cap of a container is manufactured to dimensions that enable it to be used as a measuring device when mixing the contents of the container with another substance
data.4D: Curie - A unit of radioactivity equal to 3.7 * 10/10 disintegrations per second
data.4I: Meters Per Second - Measure of linear speed
data.4J: Meters Per Second Per Second - Measure of acceleration
data.4L: Megabyte - Unit of computer storage capacity
data.4M: Milligrams Per Hour - Unit of flow
data.4P: Newtons Per Meter - Unit of measure for surface tension
data.4U: Pounds Per Hour - Rate of flow
data.4V: Cubic Meter Per Hour - Rate of flow
data.4W: Ton Per Hour - Rate of flow
data.4X: Kiloliter Per Hour - Rate of flow
data.5A: Barrels per Minute - The number of 42 gallon barrels pumped or mixed in a time period of one minute
data.5B: Batch - The quantity of material produced at one operation
data.5C: Gallons per Thousand - The number of gallons of a component material used per one thousand gallons of a process made
data.5E: MMSCF/Day - One million standard cubic feet of gas per day
data.5F: Pounds per Thousand - The number of pounds of solid material used in each 1000 gallons of fluid, mixed or pumped
data.5G: Pump - The number of pumps used on a specific job
data.5H: Stage - A period or step in a process or development
data.5I: Standard Cubic Foot - One cubic foot of gas measured at a fixed temperature and pressure; the value used for the temperature and pressure varies depending on the type of gas being measured
data.5J: Hydraulic Horse Power - A calculated measure of Horse Power using the formula rate (barrels per minute) times pressure (pounds per square inch) divided by 40.8
data.06: Digits - Expresses a value using total number of digits, e.g., 6 digits
data.16: 115 Kilogram Drum - A cylindrical container whose contents weigh 115 kilograms when full
data.17: 100 Pound Drum - A cylindrical container whose contents weigh 100 pounds when full
data.18: 55 Gallon Drum - A cylindrical container whose volume is equal to 55 gallons
data.19: Tank Truck - A liquid-carrying highway vehicle whose volume is variable according to the customer's needs and which is used as a measure of goods ordered, sold, and delivered; differs from a tank car which transports liquids by rail
data.20: 20 Foot Container - A sea-land rectangular container box whose capacity is defined by its longest dimension and by which product shipments are measured and billed
data.21: 40 Foot Container - A sea-land rectangular container box whose capacity is defined by its longest dimension and by which product shipments are measured and billed
data.22: Deciliter per Gram - Represents viscosity, Cuene intrinsic viscosity, and limit intrinsic viscosity
data.23: Grams per Cubic Centimeter - Represents product density
data.25: Grams per Square Centimeter - Represents product basis weight
data.28: Kilograms per Square Meter - Represents product basis weight
data.29: Pounds per 1000 Square Feet - Represents product basis weight
data.30: Horsepower Days per Air Dry Metric Tons - Represents the energy requirements for processing a product
data.32: Kilograms per Air Dry Metric Tons - Represents chemical addition rate during product manufacture or chemical addition within the finished product
data.33: Kilopascal Square Meters per Gram - Represents burst index measurement for pulp products
data.34: Kilopascals per Millimeter - Represents hardness index of pulp products
data.35: Milliliters per Square Centimeter Second - Represents porosity of a sheet of material
data.36: Cubic Feet per Minute per Square Foot - Represents porosity of a sheet of material
data.37: Ounces per Square Foot - Represents sheet weight
data.38: Ounces per Square Foot per 0.01 Inch - Represents sheet density
data.40: Milliliter per Second - Represents rate of absorbency
data.41: Milliliter per Minute - Represents rate of absorbency
data.43: Super Bulk Bag - A cloth, plastic, or paper-based bag having the dimensions of the pallet on which it is constructed and varying in height according to the weight and density of product contained; typically transports dry, loose materials in bulk form
data.44: 500 Kilogram Bulk Bag - A flexible container for bulk goods whose contents weigh 500 kilograms when full
data.45: 300 Kilogram Bulk Bag - A flexible container for bulk goods whose contents weigh 300 kilograms when full
data.46: 25 Kilogram Bulk Bag - A flexible container for bulk goods whose contents weigh 25 kilograms when full
data.47: 50 Pound Bag - A flexible container whose contents weigh 50 pounds when full
data.48: Bulk Car Load - A fully loaded rail car containing dry bulk loose materials
data.57: Mesh - Linear measurement of the open area of screen, net, weave, or similarly constructed item
data.90: Saybold Universal Second - A measure of kinematic viscosity, usually of oil
data.95: 20,000 Gallon Tankcar - A 20,000 gallon liquid capacity enclosed rail car
data.96: 10,000 Gallon Tankcar - A 10,000 gallon liquid capacity enclosed rail car
data.97: 10 Kilogram Drum - A cylindrical container whose contents weigh 10 kilograms when full
data.98: 15 Kilogram Drum - A cylindrical container whose contents weigh 15 kilograms when full
data.A8: Dollars per Hours - A rate expressed in dollars per hour to be charged for each hour worked
data.AD: Bytes - A computer string of data that consists of a quantity of bits, treated as a unit; a bit is a binary digit
data.AF: Centigram - A unit of metric weight equal to 0.01 gram or 0.000035 ounce
data.AH: Additional Minutes - The minutes, usually associated with usage-sensitive pricing of telecommunication services, which are above the minutes allowed for that particular service
data.AI: Average Minutes Per Call - The total number of minutes of a category of calls divided by the total number of calls within the category for telephone services calculated to provide call summary details
data.AJ: Cop - A cylindrical or conical mass of thread, yarn, or cable on a quill or a tube
data.AK: Fathom - A unit of length equal to 6.0 feet or 1.829 meters
data.AL: Access Lines - Number of lines subject to Carrier Access Line Charges
data.AN: Minutes or Messages - Number of minutes or messages contracted or used in telephone services where either the number of minutes or messages are the unit of measure for the calculation of charges
data.AQ: Anti-hemophilic Factor (AHF) Units - Intravenous administering of blood products that have been tested for potency against the U.S. medical unit of measure
data.AT: Atmosphere - Equal to the pressure of the air at sea level, or approximately 14.7 pounds per square inch
data.AU: Ocular Insert System - A drug delivery system which is placed in the lower conjunctival formix from which the drug diffuses through a membrane at a constant rate over a seven-day period
data.AV: Capsule - A compact metallic or plastic container for liquids or solids
data.AW: Powder-Filled Vials - Standard unit of intravenous blood product that has to be reconstituted with a liquid before being administered
data.AX: Twenty - 20 each of an item of supply
data.B0: British Thermal Units (BTUs) per Cubic Foot
data.BI: Bar - A centimeter-gram-second unit of pressure, equal to one million dynes per square centimeter
data.BQ: Brake horse power - The horsepower made available by an engine or turbine for driving machinery other then itself
data.D3: Square Decimeter - Metric unit of area
data.D5: Kilogram Per Square Centimeter - Unit of pressure
data.DN: Deci Newton-Meter - One tenth of a Newton-meter, representing torque. A Newton-meter represents force times distance
data.DQ: Data Records - Number of Data Records handled
data.DU: Dyne - The unit of force in the cgs system equal to the force that would give a free mass of one gram an acceleration of one centimeter per second
data.DX: Dynes per Centimeter - Unit of surface tension
data.DY: Directory Books - Number of directory books delivered to customer
data.E1: Hectometer - A unit of metric length equal to 109.36 yards or 0.062 mile
data.EB: Electronic Mail Boxes - Number of Electronic Mail Boxes established for an account
data.EQ: Equivalent Gallons - Represents number of gallons that syrup and concentrate make of product
data.F1: Thousand Cubic Feet Per Day - The unit of measure of the rate of production of a gas
data.F2: International Unit - A unit accepted by an international agency; potency of a drug/vitamin based on a specific weight of that drug/vitamin
data.F3: Equivalent - Weight of a substance which combines with or replaces one gram atomic weight of hydrogen
data.F4: Minim - An apothecary's fluid measure; 60 minims = 1 fluid gram (approx. 5 cc)
data.F5: MOL - Gram-molecular weight of a gas
data.F9: Fibers per Cubic Centimeter of Air
data.FE: Track Foot - Represents rails, all ties and fittings, and subgrade
data.FF: Hundred Cubic Meters - A unit of metric volume equal to 131.0 cubic yards
data.FG: Transdermal Patch - A drug delivery system which is placed on the skin and releases a drug at a constant rate through the skin
data.FH: Micromolar - One millionth of a mole; a mole is a standard chemical unit
data.FR: Feet Per Minute - Measure of linear speed
data.FS: Feet Per Second - Measure of linear speed
data.FZ: Fluid Ounce (Imperial) - A liquid unit of measure equal to 1/20 (.05) pint (Imperial), 28.416 cubic centimeters, or 28.416 milliliters
data.G2: U.S. Gallons Per Minute - Rate of flow
data.G3: Imperial Gallons Per Minute - Rate of flow
data.G4: Gigabecquerel - Unit of radiation equal to 27 millicuries
data.G5: Gill (Imperial) - A unit of liquid or dry measure equal to 5 fluid ounces, 8.669 cubic inches, or 142.066 cubic centimeters
data.G7: Microfiche Sheet - A film that contains photographed documents greatly reduced in size
data.GT: Gross Kilogram - Represents kilograms of product and package or container
data.GV: Gigajoules - One billion joules; standard method of expressing absolute heating value of natural gas regardless of volume in the Canadian oil and gas industries
data.GX: Grain - A small unit of weight equal to 1/480 (.002083) troy ounce, or 0.0648 gram
data.H1: Half Pages - Electronic - Number of electronic half pages of data delivered
data.H2: Half Liter - Unit of capacity equal to 1/2 liter
data.HA: Hank - One hundred feet of rope
data.IB: Inches Per Second (Vibration Velocity) - Measure of vibration velocity
data.IF: Inches of Water - The maximum differential pressure for which a given meter will measure accurately and is expressed in inches of water
data.IH: Inhaler - Metered-dose pressurized method of getting medication into the lungs or nasal passages
data.II: Column-Inches - A unit of area one column wide and one inch high
data.IP: Insurance Policy - An individual insurance contract
data.IU: Inches Per Second (Linear Speed) - Measure of linear speed
data.IV: Inches Per Second Per Second (Acceleration) - Measure of acceleration
data.IW: Inches Per Second Per Second (Vibration Acceleration) - Measure of vibration acceleration
data.J2: Joule Per Kilogram - Measure of specific energy
data.JE: Joule Per Kelvin - Measure of heat capacity
data.JG: Joule per Gram - Joule is unit of energy and gram is unit of mass
data.JK: Mega Joule per Kilogram - "Mega" means "millions" and "kilo" means "thousands"
data.JM: Megajoule/Cubic Meter - A megajoule is one million joules; conventional measurements for expressing the heating value available in a given volume of gas
data.K1: Kilowatt Demand - Represents potential power load measured at predetermined intervals
data.K2: Kilovolt Amperes Reactive Demand - Reactive power that must be supplied for specific types of customer's equipment; billable when kilowatt demand usage meets or exceeds a defined parameter
data.K3: Kilovolt Amperes Reactive Hour - Represents actual electricity equivalent to kilowatt hours; billable when usage meets or exceeds defined parameters
data.K4: Kilovolt Amperes - Measure of electrical power
data.K5: Kilovolt Amperes Reactive - Measure of electrical power
data.KE: Keg - A unit of weight equal to 100 pounds, used for nails
data.KM: Kilograms per Square Meter, Kilograms, Decimal
data.KO: Millequivalence Caustic Potash per Gram of Product - Acid number and saponification number test results have a unit of measure of Millequivalence KOH per Gram
data.L2: Liters Per Minute - Measure of the rate of flow
data.LG: Long Ton - 2240 pounds as used in the U.K.
data.LL: Lifetime - A duration ending with the death of the individual
data.LQ: Liters Per Day - Measure of liquid flow over a given time period
data.M0: Magnetic Tapes - Number of Magnetic Tapes delivered with data
data.M9: Million British Thermal Units per One Thousand Cubic Feet - Represents conversion from a volume of gas to the heat value of the gas
data.MF: Milligram per Sq. Ft. per Side
data.N1: Pen Calories - Daily calories prescribed to be taken for parenteral/enteral therapy
data.N3: Print Point - A print point is approximately .0138"
data.N4: Pen Grams (Protein) - Grams of amino acids prescribed to be taken for parenteral/enteral therapy
data.N6: Megahertz - One million cycles per second
data.N9: Cartridge Needle - Used with auto-injector units only, a disposable, filled cartridge that includes a needle
data.NF: Messages - Number of Messages transmitted, or delivered
data.NH: Message Hours - Number of hours used, calculated at some rate basis such as Minutes/message carried
data.NJ: Number of Screens - Number of data screens handled, or transmitted
data.NQ: Mho - The basic unit of electrical conductivity, having a unity value when one ampere of current flows through a conductor to which a one volt difference in electrical potential is applied
data.NR: Micro Mho - The typical unit of electrical conductivity measurement - one millionth of an Mho
data.NU: Newton-Meter - Unit of energy or torque
data.NW: Newton - Represents force in the International Metric System (SI); equal to the force that produces an acceleration of 1 meter per second on a mass of 1 kilogram
data.NY: Pounds Per Air-Dry Metric Ton - A measure of chemical addition rate during manufacture and product constituent analysis
data.P0: Pages - Electronic - Number of electronic pages of data delivered
data.PJ: Pounds, Decimal - Pounds per Square Foot - Pound Gage
data.Q2: Pint U.S. Dry - Volume equal to 33.6003125 cubic inches
data.Q3: Meal - A group of food items packaged together for human consumption
data.Q4: Fifty - A unit of issue in which a group of 50 items are consolidated and measured as a single entity
data.Q5: Twenty-Five - A unit of issue in which a group of 25 items are consolidated and measured as a single entity
data.Q6: Thirty-Six - A unit of issue in which a group of 36 items are consolidated and measured as a single entity
data.Q7: Twenty-Four - A unit of issue in which a group of 24 items are consolidated and measured as a single entity
data.QA: Pages - Facsimile - Number of FAX pages transmitted
data.QB: Pages - Hardcopy - Number of printed pages delivered
data.QH: Quarter Hours - Number of 15 minute increments of usage handled
data.QK: Quarter Kilogram - A unit of metric weight equal to 250 grams
data.R1: Pica - Approximately .166 inches measured from the top of the ascender (the upward stroke in a lowercase letter, such as "t") to the bottom of the descender (the downward stroke in a lowercase letter, such as "p"); twelve points equal one pica; six picas equal approximately one inch (.996)
data.R2: Becquerel - Unit of radiation equal to 3.7 * 10/10 of a curie
data.R4: Calorie - The amount of heat it takes to raise the temperature of one gram of water one degree Centigrade at a pressure of one atmosphere
data.RH: Running or Operating Hours - Measure of accumulated time of machine or piece of equipment has been running
data.RS: Resets - Number of times a transmission is reset due to line drop, interrupt, etc.
data.RT: Revenue Ton Miles - One ton of revenue-generating freight moving one mile
data.S6: Sessions - Number of interactive sessions handled
data.S7: Storage Units - Number of storage increments used
data.S8: Standard Advertising Units (SAUs) - A predefined partition of advertising page consisting of column-inch multiples
data.S9: Slip Sheet - A cardboard platform used for holding product for storage or transportation
data.SE: Section - 640 acres or one square mile
data.SQ: Square - A unit of measure for roofing materials equal to 100 square feet
data.SZ: Syringe - Glass or plastic barrels used to administer fluid medication under the skin, into a vein artery, or into a muscle
data.T0: Telecommunications Lines in Service - Snapshot sample of lines in service
data.U2: Tablet - A compressed or molded block of solid material; a collection of sheet paper glued together at one edge
data.U3: Ten - 10 each of an item of supply
data.U5: Two Hundred Fifty - 250 each of an item of supply
data.UB: Telecommunications Lines in Service - Average - Average number of lines in service specific to equal access requirements
data.UC: Telecommunications Ports - Number of network access ports
data.UD: Tenth Minutes - Number of 6 second increments of usage
data.UE: Tenth Hours - Number of 6 minute increments of usage
data.UL: Unitless - Unit of Measure for properties or test results without units of measure
data.UM: Million Units - Measure used to indicate large quantities in multiples of one million
data.UP: Troche - A flat, round, tablet made of a medicinal substance
data.UQ: Wafer - A light, thin, crisp, cake
data.UR: Application - An action of putting something into material contact
data.UV: Percent Topical Only - A measure of medication intended only for external use
data.V1: Flat - A shallow rectangular container frequently used for fruits and vegetables
data.VC: Five Hundred - 500 each of an item of supply
data.VS: Visit - A quantitative measure of the number of visits to a provider by the patient
data.W2: Wet Kilo - Weight of product plus liquid solution
data.X2: Bunch - A measure used to identify a group of like items grown or fastened together
data.X3: Clove - A measure used to identify a section of a separate bulb
data.X4: Drop - The smallest quantity of liquid heavy enough to form a spherical mass
data.X5: Head - A measure used for a rounded, compact mass of leaves, buds or flowers
data.X6: Heart - A measure used to identify the central or innermost physical part
data.X7: Leaf - A measure used to identify a usually green flattened structure of vascular plants processed for a particular purpose
data.X8: Loaf - A shaped mass of food cooked or prepared in one piece
data.X9: Portion - A measure used to identify a section or quantity within a larger thing
data.Y1: Slice - A measure used to identify a thin broad piece cut from a larger object
data.Y2: Tablespoon - A measure equal to three teaspoons or a half fluid ounce
data.Y3: Teaspoon - A measure equal to five milliliters or one third tablespoon
data.Y4: Tub - A measure used to identify a storage container
data.Z6: Conference Points - A participant on a conference call
